snippet: C.I.A. employees leaked the papers to the late Senator Robert C. Byrd, a Democrat from West Virginia, who suspected that Communists and subversives were influencing the cause.
abstract: Newly released Federal Bureau of Investigation records say Central Intelligence Agency employees leaked secret FBI documents about the civil rights movement to the late Sen Robert C Byrd of West Virginia and set off an angry confrontation between the two agencies in the 1960s; say Byrd suspected that Communists and subversives were influencing the movement.
lead_paragraph: C.I.A. employees leaked the papers to the late Senator Robert C. Byrd, a Democrat from West Virginia, who suspected that Communists and subversives were influencing the cause.

headline.seo: Robert Byrd Got F.B.I. Documents on Civil Rights Movement
headline.main: Byrd Got F.B.I. Documents on Civil Rights Movement
headline.print_headline: Byrd Got F.B.I. Documents On Civil Rights Movement
